sen.j: 西園寺氏（さいおんじし）は伊予国西部を領有した戦国大名。
sen.e: Saionji clan was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period (period of warring states), who dominated the western area of Iyo Province.
Saionji clan was a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period), who ruled the western area of Iyo Province.
sen.cmt: 「戦国大名」の部分を修正しました。dominated→ruled と修正しました。
sen.e: Saionji clan was a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period), who ruled the western area of Iyo Province.
Honsei (authentic surname) was Fujiwara.
sen.cmt: 本姓→定訳不明：honsei (authentic surname)としました。
sen.e: Honsei (original surname) was Fujiwara.
sen.cmt: authentic surname→original surname と修正しました。
sen.e: Honsei (original surname) was Fujiwara.

sen.j: 家系は閑院流 西園寺家の支流にあたる。
sen.e: The family line correspond to a branch of the Saionji family, Kanin line.
The family line corresponded to a branch of the Saionji family, the Kanin line.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。correspond→corresponded と修正しました。
sen.e: The family line corresponded to a branch of the Saionji family, the Kanin line.
Iyo Saionji clan
Iyo Saionji clan
Iyo Saionji clan

sen.j: 伊予の西園寺氏は、室町時代から戦国時代 (日本)にかけて伊予国南西部の宇和郡一帯（愛媛県西予市周辺）に勢力を持った武家である。
sen.e: The Saionji clan in Iyo Province was a samurai family that dominated extensively over the whole area of Uwa county (present vicinity of Seiyo City, Ehime Prefecture) of the southwestern part of Iyo Province.

The Saionji clan in Iyo Province, was a samurai family that dominated the whole area of Uwa County (present vicinity of Seiyo City, Ehime Prefecture) of the southwestern part of Iyo Province, from the Muromachi period to the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).
sen.cmt: extensively over を削除しました。county→County と修正しました。カンマを補いました。「室町時代から戦国時代（日本）にかけて」の部分を補いました。
sen.e: The Saionji clan in Iyo Province, was a samurai family that dominated the whole area of Uwa County (present vicinity of Seiyo City, Ehime Prefecture) of the southwestern part of Iyo Province, from the Muromachi period to the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan).

sen.j: 宇和地方は鎌倉時代中期の西園寺公経のときに西園寺家によってほとんど横領に近い形で所領とされ、自己の荘園とした。
sen.e: Major part of the Uwa area was usurpingly occupied by Saionji family in the mid-Kamakura Period, when Kintsune SAIONJI was in the family reign, and the family made it its own territory.

The Uwajima region became the territory of the Saionji family as almost an usurpation when Kintsune SAIONJI was in the family reign in the mid Kamakura period, and claimed as its shoen (manor in medieval Japan).
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The Uwajima region became the territory of the Saionji family as almost an usurpation when Kintsune SAIONJI was in the family reign in the mid Kamakura period, and claimed as its shoen (manor in medieval Japan).

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府滅亡から南北朝分立に至る動乱と西園寺本家断絶の混乱の中で、西園寺家庶家の西園寺公良が宇和郡に入り、在地の土豪を支配下に組み入れて領国支配を開始する。
sen.e: Amid an agitated situation from the fall of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), to the separation of the Northern and Southern Courts and the chaos caused by the discontinuance of the Saionji family, Kimiyoshi SAIONJI of a branch of Saionji family proceeded into Uwa Country and incorporated the local clans into his dominance to begin the control over the territory.
sen.cmt: 南北朝分立→定訳不明：separation of the Northern and Southern Courtsとしました。 西園寺本家断絶→定訳不明：discontinuance of the Saionji familyとしました。
sen.e: Amid the agitated situation from the fall of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to the separation of the Northern and Southern Courts and the chaos caused by the discontinuance of the Saionji family, Kimiyoshi SAIONJI, of a branch family of the Saionji family entered Uwa Country, and put the local clans under his control then began to rule over the territory.
sen.cmt: an→the,パンクチュエーションを修正しました。family を補いました。proceeded into→entered と修正しました。後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Amid the agitated situation from the fall of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to the separation of the Northern and Southern Courts and the chaos caused by the discontinuance of the Saionji family, Kimiyoshi SAIONJI, of a branch family of the Saionji family entered Uwa Country, and put the local clans under his control then began to rule over the territory.

sen.j: 戦国時代に入ると、伊予東部の河野氏や、土佐国の土佐一条氏、九州豊後国の大友氏の侵攻に遭って次第に衰退していった。
sen.e: However, in the Sengoku Period (period of warring states), the family suffered consecutive invasions by the Kono clan of the eastern Iyo Province, the Tosa-Ichijo clan of Tosa Province, Otomo clan of Bungo Province in Kyushu, and others, and the family's influence gradually declined.

However, in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), the family suffered consecutive invasions by the Kono clan of the eastern Iyo Province, the Tosa-Ichijo clan of Tosa Province, the Otomo clan of Bungo Province in Kyushu, and the family's influence gradually declined.
sen.cmt: 「戦国時代」のカッコ部分を修正しました。the を補いました。and others を削除しました。
sen.e: However, in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), the family suffered consecutive invasions by the Kono clan of the eastern Iyo Province, the Tosa-Ichijo clan of Tosa Province, the Otomo clan of Bungo Province in Kyushu, and the family's influence gradually declined.

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）、長宗我部元親の侵攻に遭って当主西園寺公広は長宗我部氏に降る。
sen.e: In 1584, the then family head, Kinhiro SAIONJI surrendered to the Chosokabe clan, after suffering from Motochika CHOSOKABE's invasion.
In 1584, the then family head, Kinhiro SAIONJI surrendered to the Chosokabe clan, after suffering from Motochika CHOSOKABE's invasion.
In 1584, the then family head, Kinhiro SAIONJI surrendered to the Chosokabe clan, after suffering from Motochika CHOSOKABE's invasion.

sen.j: そして天正13年（1585年）、長宗我部氏が豊臣秀吉の四国侵攻に遭って本国土佐国を除く3国を没収されると今度は豊臣秀吉に降伏することになるが、宇和には新領主として戸田勝隆に封じられてしまう。
sen.e: In 1585, when the Chosokabe clan lost three provinces except for its home base in Tosa Province owing to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's invasion of Shikoku, the Saionji clan surrendered to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, however, Hideyoshi appointed Katsutaka TODA as the new territory lord of Uwa Country.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1585, when the Chosokabe clan lost three provinces except for its home base in Tosa Province owing to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's invasion of Shikoku, the Saionji clan surrendered to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, however, Hideyoshi appointed Katsutaka TODA as the new territory lord of Uwa Country.

In 1585, when the Chosokabe clan lost three provinces except for its home base in Tosa Province owing to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's invasion of Shikoku, the Saionji clan surrendered to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, however, Hideyoshi appointed Katsutaka TODA as the new territory lord of Uwa Country.

sen.j: 天正15年（1587年）に公広が戸田勝隆に殺害されるに及んで伊予西園寺氏は滅亡した。
sen.e: In 1587, Kinhiro was killed by Katsutaka TODA and the Iyo-Saionji clan was downfallen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1587, Kinhiro was killed by Katsutaka TODA and the Iyo-Saionji clan was perished.
In 1587, Kinhiro was killed by Katsutaka TODA and the Iyo-Saionji clan was perished.

sen.j: ちなみに伊予西園寺氏に仕えていた土居清良が書いたとされる軍記物『清良記』（巻七「親民鑑月集」は日本最古の農書とされている）には同氏に関する記述があるが、信憑性には乏しいと言われている。
sen.e: In a military epic "Seiryoki," which is said to have been written by a retainer of the Iyo Saionji clan, Kiyoyoshi DOI, there is a description on the clan, however, it is said that the description lacks the credibility.
sen.cmt: 軍記物『清良記』→a military epic "Seiryoki" としました。
sen.e: In a military epic "Seiryoki" (volume seven 'Shinmin Kangetu shu' is said to be the oldest agricultural treatises in Japan) which is said to have been written by a retainer of the Iyo Saionji clan, Kiyoyoshi DOI, there is a description on the clan, however, it is said that the description lacks the credibility.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。（巻七「親民鑑月集」は日本最古の農書とされている）を補いました。
sen.e: In a military epic "Seiryoki" (volume seven 'Shinmin Kangetu shu' is said to be the oldest agricultural treatises in Japan) which is said to have been written by a retainer of the Iyo Saionji clan, Kiyoyoshi DOI, there is a description on the clan, however, it is said that the description lacks the credibility.

sen.j: 現在も西予市の隣、八幡浜市日土町の一部地域に西園寺氏一族の末裔と見られる家々がある。
sen.e: Even today, there remain several households that are supposed to be the descendents of the Saionji clan, in a part of Hizuchi-cho, Yawatahama City, situated next to Iyo City.
Even today, in a part of Hizuchi-cho, Yawatahama City, situated next to Iyo City, there are households that are supposed to be the descendents of the Saionji clan.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Even today, in a part of Hizuchi-cho, Yawatahama City, situated next to Iyo City, there are households that are supposed to be the descendents of the Saionji clan.
